title: pytest run is failing
body:
* py-evm Version: master (with https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1538)
* OS: osx
* Python Version 3.6.7, 3.7.1

### What is wrong?

pytest run is failling

Please include information like:

* full output of the error you received
```sh
(venv36) javi@franciscos-mbp ~/e/py-evm> pytest
================================================================== test session starts ==================================================================
platform darwin -- Python 3.6.7, pytest-3.6.4, py-1.7.0, pluggy-0.7.1
rootdir: /Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm, inifile: pytest.ini
plugins: xdist-1.18.1, cov-2.5.1, asyncio-0.9.0, asyncio-network-simulator-0.1.0a2, hypothesis-3.69.5
collected 55381 items / 3 errors / 1 skipped

======================================================================== ERRORS =========================================================================
_______________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/core/validation/test_validation.py _______________________________________________
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_validation' has this __file__ attribute:
  /Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm/tests/beacon/test_validation.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
  /Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm/tests/core/validation/test_validation.py
HINT: remove __pycache__ / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
____________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/database/test_chaindb.py ____________________________________________________
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_chaindb' has this __file__ attribute:
  /Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm/tests/beacon/db/test_chaindb.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
  /Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm/tests/database/test_chaindb.py
HINT: remove __pycache__ / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
__________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py __________________________________________
ImportError while importing test module '/Users/javi/ethereum/py-evm/tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py'.
Hint: make sure your test modules/packages have valid Python names.
Traceback:
tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py:7: in <module>
    from peer_count_reporter_plugin import PeerCountReporterPlugin
E   ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'peer_count_reporter_plugin'
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Interrupted: 3 errors during collection !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
========================================================== 1 skipped, 3 error in 13.88 seconds ==========================================================
```
* what command you ran
```sh
pytest
```

### How can it be fixed

Still debugging the issue

Fill this in if you know how to fix it.

Still debugging the issue

Hi @javimaravillas 

This doesn't happen if you run these tests through `tox` though (e.g `tox -e py36-trinity-integration`)

The failing test basically test that external plugins can be installed. We install the plugin through `tox` though.

https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/blob/f2d0d5d187400ba46a6b8f5b1f1c9997dc7fbb5a/tox.ini#L73

So, if you run these test straight through `pytest` (not through `tox`) you'll run into this because the plugin was simply not installed. Of course you can just manually install it and then running `pytest` will work as expected.

I'd say it is *slightly* annoying but it's something that could probably be improved through better docs or maybe even a raised warning that hints about this.

That said, I'm open to other solutions (e.g. doing the plugin installation from *within* the test) if they achieve what we want.
Thanks for the fast reply @cburgdorf, I will update the docs, I think is good enough
Alright! I'll close this issue. Feel free to re-open if you think it needs further discussion.

This is mighty annoying when trying to run a single test by node ID, e.g.

```
pytest -vvvvv --cache-clear --capture=no \
    -k "test_state_fixtures[/home/veox/src/py-evm/fixtures/GeneralStateTests/stBadOpcode/badOpcodes.json:badOpcodes:Constantinople:115]"
```

I either have to also specify the file:

```
pytest -vvvvv --cache-clear --capture=no \
    tests/json-fixtures/test_state.py \
    -k "test_state_fixtures[/home/veox/src/py-evm/fixtures/GeneralStateTests/stBadOpcode/badOpcodes.json:badOpcodes:Constantinople:115]"
```

... or remove the offending test files, so they don't get collected.

-----

For the first two errors, the solution could be simple, following the suggestion in error message:

```
use a unique basename for your test file modules
```

(This could also "go away" once the projects are split out of the `py-evm` codebase.)

For the `peer_count_reporter_plugin` error, perhaps it can be added as a dependency to `[dev]`, or something?.. (No good ideas yet.)
I think we should double check if we can move the installation *into* the test (instead of having it installed through `tox`).

Actually, always specifying the file turned out to be not so bad, since now `pytest` doesn't have to collect the tests on every invocation, to find which file that `test_state_fixtures` is described in - so, it all runs faster. ^_^

Still, it can be very confusing, as this issue highlights. I'm sure we'll be seeing duplicates.
